Package com.i2group.apollo.itemretrievalservice

The standard i2 Analyze item retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve any version of any stored item, alone or in groups, in a variety of ways.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IItemRetrievalService
    A pair of methods for retrieving Items from the Analysis Repository or an ELP stage.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    TooManyItemsException.Fault
    Contains information about the enclosing TooManyItemsException.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    TooManyItemsException
    The exception raised when an attempt is made to retrieve more items than the server allows.

Package com.i2group.apollo.itemretrievalservice Description

The standard i2 Analyze item retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve any version of any stored item, alone or in groups, in a variety of ways.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.

An i2 Analyze client will come to the item retrieval service with one or more item identifiers that it has previously retrieved from the search service, or from the item retrieval service itself. These identifiers may be further qualified with version numbers. The item retrieval service then provides the following functionality:

Web methodDescription
GetItems Returns the specified versions of the items with the specified identifiers.
GetLatestItems Returns the latest versions of the items with the specified identifiers.

The results that the item retrieval service returns to clients in response to either of these methods are subject to the security rules of i2 Analyze. Clients never see items whose permissions dictate that the user should not have access to them. The item retrieval service methods obey the rules of the ProhibitedRetrieve indicator.

Since:
1.0
